headline: Should Softer Results and CFO Retirement Signal a Shift in Brown-Forman's (BF.B) Long-Term Strategy?
summary: Brown-Forman Corporation recently reported its first-quarter 2025 results, with revenue of US$924 million and net income of US$170 million, both down from the prior year; the company also reiterated cautious fiscal 2026 guidance citing low-single digit declines in organic net sales and operating income. An additional development is the upcoming retirement of long-serving CFO Leanne Cunningham in May 2026, which marks a significant transition in the company's executive leadership team after...
